skill.name: Video Processor
skill.description: Process video files with audio extraction, format conversion (mp4, webm), and Whisper transcription. Use when user mentions video conversion, audio extraction, transcription, mp4, webm, ffmpeg, or whisper transcription.
skill.summary: Process video files with audio extraction, format conversion (mp4, webm), and Whisper transcription....
skill.author: EGAdams

security_audit.summary: The video-processor skill is a legitimate video processing tool with good security practices. It uses secure subprocess execution, validates inputs, and cleans up temporary files. Minor concerns include path traversal potential and external command execution, but these are mitigated by proper implementation.

medium_findings.title: Path traversal vulnerability in output paths
medium_findings.description: The skill accepts user-supplied output file paths without validation for directory traversal attempts. An attacker could potentially write files outside intended directories using '../' sequences in output paths.

low_findings.title: External command execution via FFmpeg and Whisper
low_findings.description: The skill executes external commands (FFmpeg and Whisper) via subprocess. While implemented securely using list-based commands, this represents an inherent risk that requires trust in the external tools.

low_findings.title: No file size limits for processing
low_findings.description: The skill does not enforce maximum file size limits for input files, which could lead to resource exhaustion when processing very large video files.

content.user_title: Convert and transcribe videos with FFmpeg and Whisper
content.value_statement: Process videos without manual command-line work. Extract audio, convert formats, and generate transcripts with simple commands. Perfect for content creators, educators, and developers.
actual_capabilities: Extract audio from any video file to WAV, MP3, AAC, or FLAC
Convert videos to MP4 with customizable codecs and quality settings
Convert videos to WebM format optimized for web streaming
Transcribe audio/video using OpenAI Whisper with multiple model sizes
Generate subtitles in SRT, VTT, or JSON formats with timestamps
limitations: Requires FFmpeg and OpenAI Whisper to be pre-installed on system
No cloud processing - all operations run locally on your machine
Large video files may require significant processing time and resources
Whisper transcription quality depends on audio clarity and model size

best_practices: Use the base Whisper model for quick drafts and small model for production quality
Extract audio first for long videos, then transcribe in segments for better performance
Convert to WebM with VP9 codec for best web compression and streaming quality
anti_patterns: Do not process extremely large files without considering system resources
Avoid using the large Whisper model unless maximum accuracy is essential
Do not store sensitive information in video transcripts without encryption

faq.question: Which video formats are supported?
faq.answer: MP4, AVI, MOV, MKV, WebM, FLV, WMV for video input. Audio inputs: WAV, MP3, AAC, FLAC, M4A, OGG.

faq.question: Do I need to install anything?
faq.answer: Yes, you need FFmpeg and OpenAI Whisper installed on your system before using this skill.

faq.question: Can it handle long videos?
faq.answer: Yes, but consider extracting audio first for very long videos to avoid timeouts and improve performance.

faq.question: Is my data safe?
faq.answer: All processing happens locally on your machine. No files are uploaded to external servers.

faq.question: Why is transcription taking so long?
faq.answer: Larger Whisper models provide better accuracy but require more processing time and memory.

faq.question: How accurate is the transcription?
faq.answer: Accuracy depends on audio quality and model size. Use medium or large models for best results with clear audio.
